summary: Adds items from Dawnguard to be worn with any other armor and clothing.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://img441.imageshack.us/img441/5755/nexusguide.jpg[/img]
This page might answer any questions you might have about this mod.

[color=orange][b]IMPORTANT, Please read:
This mod requires Dawnguard to work. It only adds 2 items in 2 different color schemes and 2 different positions (8 items total) that are normally a part of Dawnguard armor. This mod does NOT contain any of the items from the original mod and the original mod is NOT required to use this one.[/b][/color]


Contents:
[color=orange][b]
Description
What does this mod have to offer
How to get
How to install
How to Uninstall
Please note
Works with these mods
Known mod conflicts
[/b][/color]
[center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/donate/?mode=straight&id=1486540][img]http://i.imgur.com/P5gRKwb.png[/img][/url][/center]


[color=orange][b]Description:[/b][/color]
This mods adds items that were part of the Dawnguard armor, which can be worn with any armor or clothing. It is kind of an extension to the original mod.

[color=orange][b]What does this mod have to offer?[/b][/color]
This mod offers following items:

Leather Notebook - Front Right
Leather Notebook - Front Left
Dark Notebook - Front Right
Dark Notebook - Front Left
Leather Flask - Back Right
Leather Flask - Back Left
Dark Flask - Back Right
Dark Flask - Back Left

The notebook does not provide any bonuses and is purely cosmetic.

The flasks contain refreshing water and will increase your stamina regeneration by 3%

To see which slots the items are, using and how you can combine the items, look at the screenshot above.

Video: @ 1:45
[youtube]spDbyfmkB58[/youtube]

[color=orange][b]How to get:[/b][/color]
All items are crafted at the tanning rack. However, dark items require Rough Black Dyed Leather, which can be crafted at the forge.
Rough Black Dyed Leather is crafted by combining Leather and Frostbite Venom.
Unfortunately, you cannot use the Black Dyed Leather from the original mod instead of Rough Black Dyed Leather and vise versa.

[color=orange][b]How to install:[/b][/color]
Extract the files from the archive into your Data folder. Check the Dr_BandolierDG.esp in your "data files", in the launcher.

[color=orange][b]How to uninstall:[/b][/color]
If you wish to uninstall the mod, make sure to unequip the items first. Otherwise you will still have the permanent effect on your character.

[color=orange][b]Please note:[/b][/color]
The items might appear floating in front of the body if you are using very thin armor or are naked. The items were adjusted to be used with armor.

[color=lightblue][b]Also available on Steam Workshop! Always the updated version.[/b][/color]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=88443010

[color=orange][b]Works with these mods: [/b][/color]
This is a small list of mods that use some of the special slots, and do not conflict with this one.
Original “Bandolier – Bags and Pouches”
Black Sacrament Armor mods (but left satchels share same slot)
Cloaks of Skyrim
Winter Is Coming - Cloaks
Leather Backpack
Sabre Gear Backpack /// Fur Bag - Backpack
Dwemer Goggles and Scouter
Wearable Lanterns (Uses same slot as the back right pouch)

[color=orange][b]Known mod conflicts:[/b][/color]
The mod might conflict with any other mods that use the same slots (48, 55, 57, 58).
Angelic Halos and Demonic Horns (Items in that mods use a couple of the same slots)
The Aesir Armor mod (A few decorative items in the mod use the same slots)
author: Dragten
